attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Add recycling to the curriculum. Even if it's 1 day a year - possibly a visit.
attributes.background:
Incorrect recycling costs taxes.
I received a leaflet about what can be recycled in my area. It also explained the process which interested me. I think more education is needed.

Children are the future this will help them recycle correctly or even improve the system.
attributes.additional_details:
School is where we learn life skills, preparing us for adulthood. Recycling is currently not as efficient as it could be because the public are not fully educated. Personally I've attended beach cleans, researched where to recycle electronics / printer parts / clothes... It is all difficult to follow.

If schools had one lesson a year dedicated to recycling.
Maybe an expert from the industry could visit, they would learn the common mistakes of recyclers. Some would see it as a career path.

attributes.action: Make causing a psychological injury (mental illness) a criminal offence.
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to make it a crime to intentionally or recklessly cause unnecessary psychological injury to another; add mental illness to the list of reportable injuries in relation to work; and ensure that the cause of any illness that leads to a suicide is fully investigated.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people suffers a mental illness during their lifetime.
Sometimes this is directly attributable to the behaviour of another or others.  In these cases the only legal remedy is a personal injury claim which lacks personal accountability and doesn't encourage improved behaviour.
In addition, psychological injuries don't currently have to be reported to the Health and Safety Executive so are not monitored.
Mental abuse is serious and should be given the same importance as physical abuse.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Protect pension funds from asset strippers by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees. However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.
Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company. 
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Allow store loyalty card schemes to award points on the purchase of baby formula
attributes.background:
The law as it stands prohibits stores from issuing loyalty card points on the sale of baby milk formula. Parents are barred from amassing points to make savings.

This is unfair to parents who don't always have a choice in using formula. Also to parents exercising their right to choose not to.
attributes.additional_details:
The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula (England) Regulations 2007 (section 23) prohibits marketing of baby formula. Loyalty card schemes are being caught up in this, barring parents from accruing points and making savings. 

The purchase is being made regardless, without promotional inducement. The collection of points by parents cannot be called marketing.

The legislation can be found here

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2007/3521/regulation/23/made

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Create a National Roads Agency for the repair and maintenance of all roads.
attributes.background: I have had to repair damage to three wheels on my car which were caused by potholes. While driving I spend more time looking out for the potholes and swerving to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in this country now compare to that of a third world country and are full of potholes. With local authorities unable to eradicate this problem and only repair the roads on a small scale it is time for the government to set up a national agency with the sole responsibility to repair and maintain roads in England. Motorists already pay enough money through their car road tax and fuel tax and get very little in return.

attributes.action: Change delay repay minimum delay to 5 minutes.
attributes.background: Currently delay repay schemes only compensate customers who experience delays of between 15 minutes and 30 minutes. Many more customers who are regularly delayed by 5 minutes or more receive no compensation. This needs to change. Train companies need to be held to account for their mistakes/delays.

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Extend the Culture Secretary's recent FOBT decision to cover online casino games
attributes.background: On 17th May, Culture Secretary Matt Hancock opted to limit stakes on FOBTs in high street Bookmakers to £2 from £100 on the grounds they are “a social blight”. The policy needs to extend to the very same games  of chance on bookmakers/casino websites, usually undertaken in a solitary environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Online 'FOBT' games offer no social interaction and less protection than the high street equivalent.

http://www.techaddiction.ca/online-gambling-casino.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2395877/A-terrifying-parable-addictive-power-internet-gambling-It-began-5-online-bet-Then-ex-Major-gambled-away-750-000--family.html

http://www.gamcare.org.uk/forum/getting-addicted-online-roulette

https://www.onlineroulette.com/guides/addictive-roulette/

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Change the Law so Property Owners can Keep Balls that Persistently go in Gardens
attributes.background: Damage to Plants with Footballs Snapping Them off, also Scuff Marks left on Vehicles due to getting impregnated with Grit, Owners should be able to take a Pride in their Gardens and Vehicles, although a Law under Section 161 Highways it is an Offence to Play on the Highway causing a Nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people throughout the Country have these issues, it is Stupid to give the Balls back time again to be Kicked over again and again, let’s get the Law on the side of Property Owners, Many Letters in the Press suggest many suffer which should NOT be the case.

Let’s get things put right.

attributes.action: Parliament should debate the future of UK overseas territories
attributes.background: At present UK overseas territories have an anomalous status that allows them to be used for money laundering and other nebulous purposes while at the same time denying their inhabitants full sovreignty and a say in the most important aspects of their governance.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally Overseas Territories should be asked to choose between full independence within the Commonwealth or becoming integrated parts of the UK with Westminster representation (after the model of French overseas department).

attributes.action: british soldier should be free from prosecution unless dishonourably discharged
attributes.background: No British soldier should ever face criminal charges whilst in the execution of his duties within the armed forces, whether within the british isles or abroad. This should apply across the board and be retrospective save for those who are dishonourably discharged.
attributes.additional_details: Scurrilous accusations are inevitable and it is disgraceful that governments past and present have not seen fit to prevent the prosecution of men and women who have risked their very lives for the uniform and the people they serve.

attributes.action: Change The Colour Of Rear Vehicle Registration Plates To White
attributes.background: In many countries around the world registration plates on vehicles tend to be white at the front and white at the back. In the UK our rear plate is yellow, which spoils the appearance of our vehicles. White number plates would go with any body paintwork colour and this should be adopted.
attributes.additional_details: With our vehicles currently having a white registration plate at the front it would make sense to match this with a white registration plate at the back.

attributes.action: A complete review of the justice system in reference to sexual criminals
attributes.background: We,the people ask the government invests time into reviewing the path of justice in reference to sexual crimes. Time and time again we hear about rapists perverts and peadophiles absconding or breaking court orders. There should be manadatory life senticing for rapists.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK only second offences can be considered for mandatory life, we demand that the leniency given to sexual criminals be investigated by an impartial committee. We demand the laws regarding sentencing are thrown out and rewritten. The U.K. is far to lenient on sexual criminals. Most of the time you will see they recieve a 5 month sentence. This is not good enough. The safety of our children is at stake.

attributes.action: Launch an awareness campaign for the causes and symptoms of skin cancer
attributes.background: Last year I had Melanoma and there was little awareness out there, there is more than 1 type of skin cancer. I feel that there is little awareness out there about them and about damage the sun/sun beds can do. There needs to be more campaigns to help prevent it.

attributes.action: Introduce Stronger Legislation Governing The Sale of Animal Grooming Products.
attributes.background: At present, companies that produce cosmetic products for animals are under no legal compulsion to label their products appropriately or adhere to the safety standards that regulate the sale of human cosmetics. We want the UK Government to address this with the introduction of stronger legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation affecting the sale of pet products is currently encompassed by EU Cosmetic Regulation 1223/2009 and Section 7.7 (a) of Regulation (EC) No 648/2004 on detergents (European Union, 2009) which states there is no 'sector specific' legislation governing the sale of pet grooming products. We believe the UK can lead the world in introducing stronger legislation forcing a reappraisal in the way in which these products are regulated and labelled.

attributes.action: At 17 you should be able to ride atleast a 250Cc superbike / Pitbike ( Crosser )
attributes.background:
At 17 you're legally allowed to ride a 125Cc. (75 MPH max ).        
So instead make it so you can ride a 250 Cc.

attributes.action: Make the current VED rates retrospective to cars registered from 2000 onwards.
attributes.background: The current VED system is grossly unfair. Cars registered now can emit 249g of CO2 yet only pay £140 PA VED. A car registered in 2007 emitting the same CO2 pays £540 PA VED! It gets even worse though, the EXACT SAME CAR registered up to March 2006 pays £315 PA VED!
attributes.additional_details: Seeing as the whole point of the CO2 based system was for environmental reasons why are older cars not treated the same as new ones? The CO2 coming out of the exhaust is the same! This situation is actually costing the government money as owners of these cars SORN them hence ZERO tax revenue!!

attributes.action: Protect against big business interests with a “People’s” lobby group fund
attributes.background: The government should change the law to impose a 10% tax on all payments to lobbying organisations.  The tax receipts could be used to establish and fund a public taxpayer interest group which would review all lobbying activities and participate and publicly report on each policy decision change.
attributes.additional_details:
The democratic system is systematically undermined every day by individuals, corporations and organizations who act to influence the actions, policies and decisions of government officers on their own behalf or for a selected group’s personal advantage or gain to the exclusion of the majority.

It is important for government officials and MPs serve the public interest first and not get mislead by lobbying parties or advisors who inadvertently act in a lobbying capacity.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: Institute a Personage & Citizenry Act
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on parliament to institute a new act that grants automatic citizenship to any persons that can demonstrate that they have lived continuously in this country for 15 or more years. Subject to having not committed a serious criminal offence
attributes.additional_details:
This act would help secure the rights of people affected by the windrush scandal as well as those people who have migrated here that may be subject to the same treatment in the future.

Personage should be granted to those who are working here to act as a temporary status of citizenry for 5 years. If they continue to hold employment for that time then at the end of the 5 years they are granted full citizenry.

attributes.action: Allow English local authorities to choose the voting system for their council
attributes.background: Currently, English local authorities must use the First Past the Post voting system. Due to the Government's localism agenda, we the undersigned believe that local councils are best placed to decide their own voting system to ensure greater accountability and voter choice.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many examples of one-party councils across England, which has resulted in a lack of transparency and accountability with no effective opposition. We know that when councils face robust opposition and scrutiny, they spend less and deliver better value for money for the local communities they provide for.
 
https://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/The-Cost-of-One-Party-Councils.pdf

attributes.action: Stop Public Health England's recent 'Healthy Eating' initiatives.
attributes.background: PHE have launched several initiatives to make people more 'calorie-aware'. This includes Change4Life's 'look for 100-calorie snacks, two a day max' and the One You Campaign, which advises adults to follow a 400-600-600 diet. Calorie Counting leads to a fixation on numbers and disordered eating.
attributes.additional_details: Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder, with at least 20% of Anorexia sufferers dying prematurely. (Source: BEAT Eating Disorders). Full recovery from this illness involves moving away from all preoccupation with food. Therefore, calorie counting is incompatible with recovery and may lead to a rise in eating disorders. Please support me to ensure more people are protected from this life-ruining condition.

attributes.action: Examine Greybull's actions in respect of insolvency of Monarch Airline/Holidays.
attributes.background: Monarch ceased trading on Monday 2 October 2017, leaving 2,000 employees without jobs and 860,000 passengers without flights. This is Greybull’s third venture that has failed and the largest failure in British aviation history.
attributes.additional_details: We question the entire involvement of Greybull Capital in respect of Monarch. From reports it would appear that both prior and post insolvency the UK Government have pumped millions of pounds into Greybull Capital and although Greybull state they have lost out in excess of £100 million it is reported that Monarch had £48 million in the bank and aircraft take off and landing slots will be worth at least £60 million to Greybull. These figures alone equate to greater than £100 million.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Introduce carbon tax in the UK.
attributes.background: The UN recently reported that we have 12 years to reduce carbon emission by 45% or we will face a climate change catastrophe. According to a study published by the Guardian it is reported that just 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global emissions. We need to take action!
attributes.additional_details:
By introducing a carbon tax it will encourage companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide will lower their carbon footprint or companies will turn to renewable energy.  This is real and cannot be avoided, going vegan, having a shower instead of a bath, cycling all help but companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere need to dealt with.
Watch this video here for more information - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CilVymuAM8A

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement to inform UK phone callers the cost of phone calls
attributes.background: The cost of phone calls from a mobile phone or landline should be regulated so that prior to connection a prerecorded message should make the charge per minute clear to the caller and all Utility companies and Charities for the low paid and vulnerable should have available freephone contact numbers
attributes.additional_details: Offcom really need to put their house in order they have consistently failed to inform the public about how much money they are paying for phone calls especially on 'pay as you go'. Some phone numbers in the UK which are regularly used by those on low incomes and those on benefits are being charged at exorbitant rates which they can ill afford. Im sue many of these people end up not making  calls because of the cost and end up being penalised for not informing a company or government department

attributes.action: Make dentist check ups and all necessary treatments free on the NHS
attributes.background: If I go to a doctor for a check up or with a problem it doesn't cost me anything. Yet if I go to the dentist I have to pay. If I break my arm or need an operation I don't need to pay for it. If I break my tooth or need something done to my teeth I need to pay.
attributes.additional_details: I work hard and pay my national insurance. I should not need to pay for NHS dentists. If I received certain benefits I could get the dentist for free, but as always regular hard working people of the country who don’t qualify for benefits have to pay for everything. Your teeth are important, it's part of your health and can cause major problems if there is something wrong. Nobody should not need to pay to be seen or treated by a dentist on the NHS!

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: I believe that, unless there is a ‘baby changing room’ already allocated, there should be changing facilities in all female AND male bathrooms.
attributes.additional_details: I am tired of visiting family restaurants and being the only adult able to change our baby! I am yet to see baby changing facilities in male bathrooms and it makes life for my husband difficult and especially restricting when he is alone with the children. I also wonder how it must make male, same sex couples feel as parents when neither can visit the ladies bathroom.

attributes.action: End Equal Opportunities Question about your race when applying for jobs
attributes.background: When applying for a job vacancies in the UK the employer always state that they are an equal opportunity employer and  you are required to state your ethnic minority group. Now this give the employer the opertunity discriminate against prospective employees the election  process.
attributes.additional_details: People from ethnic minority groups are being discriminate against whilst applying for job vacancy online In the pre selection process by employer. The question about stating what ethnic minority group you are from should be omitted from online application forms all together. If you are applying for a job that you are qualified for the question about your race shouldn't be of importance to the employer for selection. I applied for the same job with the same details but change my race from one to next and recieve a call the following day.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people who kill others and rape children.
attributes.background: Many rapists go into prison and then come out to commit the same crime which is a massive issue with the system today many rape victims feel scared their rapist will try to attack them again. These people who commit these crimes shouldn't be allowed back into society.

attributes.action: Lower the legal age for buying alcohol and tobacco to 16 years old
attributes.background: Currently, students and under 18's nationwide are breaking the law in order to have a good time. Attempting to buy alcohol and tobacco under the age of 18 can lead to the criminalisation of young people.
attributes.additional_details: There are already approximately 136,500+ under 18's smoking on a daily basis. Being unable to buy alcohol and tobacco has not discouraged them and the added risk of under 18's joining the "wrong crowd" can lead them to further crime in their future life.

attributes.action: Make Pads and Tampons Free
attributes.background: Because why should women have to pay so much money for a natural occurrence. People would be against women walking around with period blood everywhere so why should we have to pay!
attributes.additional_details: Once I started my period in a public toilet and the tampons were  £1 for 2 tampons. This is outrageous.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html
